glsa.title: libpng: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libpng which can allow a remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: libpng is a standard library used to process PNG (Portable Network Graphics) images. It is used by several programs, including web browsers and potentially server processes.

description.p: The png_push_read_chunk function in pngpread.c in the progressive decoder enters an infinite loop, when it encounters a zero-length IDAT chunk. In addition certain integer overflows have been detected and corrected.
The 1.2 branch is not affected by these vulnerabilities.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PNG file using an application linked against libpng, possibly resulting in Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
